quote: Captain's log, Stardate 42723.8.   The Enterprise is en route to the   Epsilon Nine Sector for   astronomical survey of a new   pulsar cluster. In the meantime,   Ensign Crusher will be diverting   to Starbase five one five for   progressive Starfleet exams...
This just came in from Starfleet--
scene: 2    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE TURBOLIFT DOORS

quote: The testing parameters?
scene: 2    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE TURBOLIFT DOORS

quote: Do not be apprehensive. I found   the Academy examinations quite   elementary.
scene: 2    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE TURBOLIFT DOORS

quote: You would.
scene: 2    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE TURBOLIFT DOORS

quote: Your earlier test results were   good enough to get you Academy   credit for your work here. I   don't think you have anything to   worry about.
scene: 2    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE TURBOLIFT DOORS

quote: But those Academy cadets are   pretty competitive, you know.
scene: 2    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE TURBOLIFT DOORS

quote: They don't have your practical   experience, Wes.
scene: 2    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE TURBOLIFT DOORS

quote: Commander Riker is correct. While   the information imparted to cadets   at the Academy is unquestionably   vital for prospective Starfleet   officers, it nevertheless requires   a significant period of   supplementary systems training   and situational disciplines.
scene: 2    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE TURBOLIFT DOORS

quote: Data... isn't that what I just   said?
scene: 2    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE TURBOLIFT DOORS

quote: Yes, Commander. But not quite   as perspicuously.
scene: 2    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE TURBOLIFT DOORS

quote: I won't have you telling me what   course to set!
As chief medical officer, I am   ordering you to report to Starbase   five one five immediately!
Oh, please. I feel fine.
The truth is, you've neglected   this far too long.
This ship has a mission to carry   out.
An astronomical survey to be   conducted by the science officers,   I believe.
I've been looking forward to   seeing the Epsilon Pulsar Cluster   for myself.
Then we'll perform the procedure   right here.
Absolutely not.
My staff and I are perfectly   capable of giving you the   replacement.
That's not the point. Not only   am I in splendid health, but it   would be inappropriate for you   to perform the procedure.
Why Captain Picard, I had no idea.   You do have an ego, don't you?
Clarify.
You're concerned about your image.
I never said that.
Don't worry. Get yourself down   to Starbase five one five and your   image will be safe with me.
Captain... excuse me.
scene: 4    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE TURBOLIFT DOORS

quote: I understand you're heading for   Starbase five one five.
scene: 4    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE TURBOLIFT DOORS

quote: Yes, sir. I was just on my way   to Shuttle Bay Two.
scene: 4    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE TURBOLIFT DOORS

quote: Good. I have some business of   my own there. I shall accompany.   you.
scene: 4    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE TURBOLIFT DOORS

quote: You will?    (then, composing     himself)   I mean, yessir!
scene: 4    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE TURBOLIFT DOORS

quote: Prepare the shuttle for immediate   departure.
scene: 4    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE TURBOLIFT DOORS

quote: Aye, sir.
scene: 4    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE TURBOLIFT DOORS

quote: Is there something I can take care   of for you at Starbase   five one five?
scene: 4    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE TURBOLIFT DOORS

quote: I'm afraid not, Number One.
scene: 4    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE TURBOLIFT DOORS

quote: But you'll miss the Epsilon Pulsar   survey.
scene: 4    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE TURBOLIFT DOORS

quote: I'm very well aware of that. You   have the bridge. Carry on.
scene: 4    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - THE TURBOLIFT DOORS

quote: What is it, Number One?
Is something wrong? This trip   to Starbase five one five seems   rather unexpected.
Not to worry. Ensign Crusher and   I will rendezvous with you on your   return from the Epsilon Pulsar   Cluster.
Forgive my saying so, sir, but   you're being rather enigmatic.
Consider it captain's privilege.
As first officer, I have complete   security clearance--
This has nothing to do with ship's   business.       Suffice it to say that this is   strictly a matter of ...vanity.
Starbase five one five's not   exactly around the corner, Wes.   You have quite a trip ahead of   you.
Yeah. I know.
Relax. You'll do fine on your   exams.
It's not the exams I'm worried   about. It's Captain Picard.
Why? He's not taking the exams.
He's coming with me to starbase.   Just the two of us. Nearly a   six-hour transit. What am I going   to talk to him about for six   hours?
Archaeology...semantics...   literature... art... you can learn   a lot from Captain Picard.
Nice day for a little trip,   Captain?
Hardly.
Shuttle Number Two ready for   departure.
We are at impulse speed and you   are cleared for departure.
Data... wasn't the captain looking   forward to this mission to the   Epsilon Pulsar Cluster?
So he had said.
Then what would make him change   his mind? Why would he leave the   ship now?
Receiving a Mayday on all   frequencies, sir!
Source?
Rhomboid Dronegar Sector   zero-zero-six--
Detail.
Ship...unidentified...distress.   Nothing more.
Set course for Rhomboid Dronegar   zero-zero-six at warp seven.
Sir... Rhomboid Dronegar sector   will put us at considerable   distance from Captain Picard.
I know, Data. I know.
Entering Rhomboid Dronegar Sector   zero-zero-six.
I have a ship on target path.
Slow to impulse speed.
Viewer.
Deploy shields, sir?
Hold fast.       Data?
Basic early design capable of   sub-light travel only.
Commander, we are being hailed.
On screen.
I am First Officer William Riker.   This is the USS Enterprise,   responding to your distress   signal--
Uh-hunh.
What is your problem?
We are far from home.
So are we, but you sent out a   Mayday--
Uh-hunh
Do you need help?
We are Pakleds. Our ship is the   Mondor.    (re the work in the     b.g.)   It is broken.
Sensors indicate engineering   problems.
Lieutentant La Forge to bridge...
They have experienced total   guidance system failure and they   have less than twenty-four hours' reserve   power.
What brings you so far from home?
We look for things.
What were you looking for?
Things we need.
Can you be more specific?
Uh-hunh.
Then please do so.
Things that make us go. We need   help.
Let me guess: their rubber band   broke, right?
What is the nature of your   mission?
We look for things.
Do you hear an echo?    (then, back to     viewscreen)   Understood. Our chief engineer   will beam aboard to help you--       Out.
Wait a minute... me?
Do we truly need to send our chief   engineer over to them?
They obviously need our help.
Why do we not simply give them   the information they need to make   their repairs?
Do you honestly think they could   handle our technical   specifications?
We don't know that much about   them. I urge caution.
Acknowledged, Worf... but we have   an obligation to render aid.    .   Report to the Transporter Room   with all necessary gear.
Aye, sir.
We need more information.
Do you have anything else on them?
They are a relatively benign   species.
Don't they seem a little... slow?
They may merely have   poorly-developed language skills.
What about weapons?
Our scan shows very limited   armaments.
I think we can relax, Worf. They   can't even get their ship moving   without our help, and we certainly   have them outmanned and outgunned.
E.t.a. thirteen-thirty hours.
Not exactly warp speed, sir.
More like a late twenty-second century   interplanetary journey.
Sir?
You should read more history,   Ensign.
Yes sir.
Complete waste of time...
Pardon, sir?
I shouldn't be taking this trip   at all. I belong back on the   Enterprise.
Why are you going with me to   Starbase five one five, Captain?
It's certainly not my idea!
I'm sorry. I don't mean to take   it out on you.       I just hate going through another   damned cardiac replacement.
Cardiac replacement? I didn't   know...
Now you do.
A parthenogenetic implant?
What else would it be?       My own heart was injured and a   replacement was necessary. That   would have been it except that   the replacement is flawed and must   now be put right.
Why would anyone use a flawed   replacement?
Just pilot the shuttle, Ensign.
All right. Let's get these   repairs made so we can all be on   our way.       First officer to La Forge...
Aye, Commander. Ready for   transport.
Proceed.
Energize...
Hey, hey, it's okay. I'm here   to help. Take it easy.
We are far from home.
What seems to be the problem?
Our ship is the Mondor.
Right. I got that already.       Who's in charge of engineering?
My friend. His name is Reginod.
Think I could meet him?
We have an engineer.
Great...
He is Reginod.
Yes, I think you mentioned that.
We look for things.
So I've heard.
It is broken.
Well... maybe I can fix it.
Can you make our ship go?
I think so.
We look for things to make us go.
Fellas... why don't you show me   where your guidance system is?
He is smart.
Commander... Lieutenant La Forge   is on an alien ship?
Yes. We're rendering assistance   to some curious throwbacks.
How they ever mastered the   rudiments of space travel is a   genuine curiosity.
Commander... Those aliens... what   they feel is not helplessness   ... Lieutenant La Forge is in great   danger!
Danger... great danger...
Can you be more specific,   Counselor?
They are insincere... It is not   our help they want.
Help is all they're going to get.   They certainly can't force   anything upon us, can they?
You feel they are weak.
Look at them. Not exactly Jarada   or Romulans.
Our Betazoid counselor is often   aware of things beyond our   perceptive abilities.
Van Doren's technique has been   perfected to two point four   percent.
Sir?
The cardiac replacement procedure.   It has a very low mortality rate.   Two point four percent.
Those are pretty good odds.
The fact is, I'm not interested   in having my innards become the   subject of Starfleet gossip.
Of course, sir. But why didn't   you have Doctor Pulaski perform   the operation? You could've   trusted her to keep it quiet.
Let's just say I have personal   reasons and leave it at that,   shall we?
The power needs to be rerouted   through this venturi chamber   before it can be channeled through   the engine coils.
It is broken.
But not for long. See? We're   going to reconfigure these   separators here...
It is broken.
You are brilliant.
Actually, any first year   engineering intern could do the   same thing--
Lieutenant La Forge, this is   Commander Riker...
Yes, Commander. Go ahead.
Are you all right?
Sure. Why do you ask?
Counselor Troi has expressed   misgivings about your absence from   The Enterprise.
I don't think there's much to   worry about.
Understood. But as soon as the   repairs are completed, I want you   back here.
Aye, sir, I should be done   momentarily.
There. Guidance is up and   running.
Main power failure?
Will our ship go now?
The guidance system's repaired,   but you're not going anywhere   without main power.
It is broken.
Can you make it go?
Commander Riker, it looks like   this might take a little longer   than I anticipated...
You don't really care much for   people, do you?
What?
It's okay. You can just do   without most people. I can   understand that --
Ensign...Wesley. That's not true.   I have great regard for you, for   example. You're a fine young   man.
You don't have to say that.
I do not say what I do not mean.
Well, it's pretty obvious how you   feel.
Is it? How so?
Well, everyone knows. You don't   like kids.
I simply have... other priorities.
That's too bad.       You might've made a pretty good   father.
Thank you.
Didn't you ever wish you had kids   of your own?
Wishing for a thing does not make   it so.
We send him over there for one   set of repairs and now they need   him for more.
Their ship is apparently quite   fragile.
This is Riker on board the   Enterprise.
I repeat. This is Commander Riker   of the Enterprise.
Almost got it, Commander--
We look for things.
Apparently your ship is in need   of more than minor repairs.
Things to make it go.
We will use our tractor beam to   tow you to your nearest base.
He can make it go.
Yes, but we need our chief   engineer back on board our ship--
He is smart.
All done, Commander.
Prepare to beam over.
Yes, sir.
You are good.
Thanks. We aim to please.
We need you.
I'm flattered. Now I hate to   repair and run, but if you'll   excuse me...
One to beam aboard--
Hey!
Transporter room, beam La Forge   over immediately.
Aye... negative response, sir!
Try again!
Negative response!
The Pakled ship has a shield up,   sir!
A shield? What kind?
It appears to be beyond their   technology... similar to Romulan   shields!
Do not interfere with our   transporter beam. Repeat. Drop   your shield--
Status!
Viewer transmission terminated   and blocked.
Hail on all frequencies.
scene: 31   INT. THE MAIN BRIDGE - RIKER, DATA, WORF, TROI

quote: Running frequency search...   negative response.
scene: 31   INT. THE MAIN BRIDGE - RIKER, DATA, WORF, TROI

quote: They're ignoring us!
scene: 31   INT. THE MAIN BRIDGE - RIKER, DATA, WORF, TROI

quote: Apparently so, sir.
scene: 31   INT. THE MAIN BRIDGE - RIKER, DATA, WORF, TROI

quote: Phasers ready, sir.
scene: 31   INT. THE MAIN BRIDGE - RIKER, DATA, WORF, TROI

quote: Shields up.
scene: 31   INT. THE MAIN BRIDGE - RIKER, DATA, WORF, TROI

quote: Shields up.
scene: 31   INT. THE MAIN BRIDGE - RIKER, DATA, WORF, TROI

quote: Sensors at maximum sensitivity.
scene: 31   INT. THE MAIN BRIDGE - RIKER, DATA, WORF, TROI

quote: Sensors at maximum.
scene: 31   INT. THE MAIN BRIDGE - RIKER, DATA, WORF, TROI

quote: Phasers ready, sir.
scene: 31   INT. THE MAIN BRIDGE - RIKER, DATA, WORF, TROI

quote: Hold fire. Lieutenant La Forge   is on that ship.
scene: 31   INT. THE MAIN BRIDGE - RIKER, DATA, WORF, TROI

quote: Were you ever married?
My career always came first. I   never had time.
Don't you ever get lonely?
There have been certain costs   involved.
Well, I'll bet you've broken your   fair share of hearts along the   way...
A man needs to be careful about   that sort of thing.
Don't worry about me. Where women   are concerned, I'm in complete   control.
Really? I've always had to work   at it.
Have you always known what you've   wanted... been so disciplined?
No.       That's why I'm going in to get   this thing replaced.
I don't understand.
Well... I was a young Starfleet   officer. Just a few years older   than you are now. Green as hell.   Top of my Academy Class, and oh,   so proud. Too proud, as it turned   out.
What happened?
Several of us were on leave at   Far Space Starbase   Earhart... something of a galactic   outpost in those days--
Before the Klingons joined the   Federation?

That's right. My mates and I were   at the Bonestell Recreation   Facility, which was nothing more   than a crossroads at the time.   A trio of Nausicaans came in.   They were spoiling for a   confrontation with some   fresh-faced young Starfleet   officers like ourselves. Everyone   in our group had the good sense   to back away and give these   Nausicaans wide berth. Everyone   but me, that is. I stood   toe-to-toe with the nastiest of   the three and let him know what   I thought of him, his partners,   and his planet. I probably even   made some passing reference to   his questionable parentage.
The next thing I knew, I had all   three of them on me and I was   fighting for my life. Acquitted   myself quite well for several   furious exchanges, I'm proud to   say.
You fought them? And won?

I had this one Nausicaan down on   the floor in a particularly   devious joint-lock when before   I knew what was happening, one   of his cohorts drew his weapon   and impaled me through the back.   Strange sensation, actually. Not   much pain. Shock, certainly, at   the sight of serrated metal coming   out of one's chest, and then a   certain giddy warmth. As I   recall, I actually laughed aloud.   It pierced my heart, of course,   and if we hadn't been so near a   medical facility I would surely   have died.
Really? Really? Then what?

Then nothing. I was no hero.   I was an undisciplined,   opinionated, loud-mouthed young   man who was far out of his league.   It was a great and painful lesson,   but I learned it well. I only   hope you won't need to learn it   as I did...
Data, come on...
I am programming the comm system   to scan the interference patterns,   but a full analysis will take   time.
Please... no more.
This is fun.
My VISOR...
This does something.
Yes. It allows me to see.
Where is it? Give it to me--
Can you make us go now?
He cannot make us go.
He is not smart.       This is smart.
Be careful with that thing.
You want to hurt us.
What? I came here to help you.       I fixed your guidance system and   the main power generator, didn't   I?
We can make more.
You have a replicator?
It is not broken.
I didn't come here to give you   weapons.
(re: the phaser, points     it at Geordi)   You will make more.
Commander, a photon torpedo may   penetrate their shield.
scene: 37   INT. THE ENTERPRISE - MAIN BRIDGE - WORF

quote: Any hostile move on our part   would only jeopardize Geordi.
scene: 37   INT. THE ENTERPRISE - MAIN BRIDGE - WORF

quote: But what do the Pakleds want?
scene: 37   INT. THE ENTERPRISE - MAIN BRIDGE - WORF

quote: Counselor?
scene: 37   INT. THE ENTERPRISE - MAIN BRIDGE - WORF

quote: They have what they want... for   now.
scene: 37   INT. THE ENTERPRISE - MAIN BRIDGE - WORF

quote: Did you read that book I gave   you?
Some of it.
That's reassuring.
I just don't have much time.
(re the book in his     hand)   There is no greater challenge than   the study of philosophy.
William James sure won't be on   my Starfleet exams.
The important things never will   be. Anyone can be trained to deal   with technology, and the   mechanics of piloting a starship.
But Starfleet Academy--
It takes more than just that.   Open your mind to the past... to   history, art, philosophy. And   then...       ... this will mean something.

Just consider James' wisdom:   "Philosophy... is not a technical   matter... it is our sense of what   life honestly means... our   individual way of feeling the   total push and pressure of the   cosmos."       That's what I want for you.
It is all deception. Lies.
Everything? What about the   distress call?
Nothing the Pakleds have said or   done has been sincere.
Intensified scan shows their   guidance system is perfectly   intact, as is their power   generator.
Then what was Geordi repairing?
Apparently, the putative   malfunctions were carefully   programmed into their ship's   computer.
I didn't think the Pakleds had   that kind of technology.
They seem to have made some   technological leaps forward,   Commander.
But why would they go through   the charade of needing our help?
For the sole purpose of making   Lieutenant La Forge their prisoner.
Options?
Tactically speaking, we have   three choices: we can negotiate,   attack, or simply abandon   Lieutenant La Forge.
You don't want to be late for your   exams, Ensign.
I've still got some time, sir.
Why do I get the feeling you're   acting like some kind of escort?
Doctor Pulaski asked me to make   sure you actually went inside.
That woman. She would.
Sir?
What is it?
I enjoyed our trip together.
So did I.
They are initiating visual   contact--
Maybe we'll find out what the hell   they really want.
Enterprise.
We demand the immediate return   of our crewmember.
Request denied.
Lower your shield!
Request denied.
Stop it! What do you want?
Your ship has bigger ones.
For defense against attack.
Your ship is strong. Smart.
Our strength contributes to peace   in this region of the galaxy.   We mean no one harm.
You think we are not smart.
I think you need to continue to   develop --
We are smart.
Prove it. Return our man to us.
You want him?
Yes, dammit!
Good. We want all computer   information from your ship.    (aims the phaser at     Geordi again)   Now.
We've got a man held hostage by   alien forces and all I have are   non-option options! I'd like some   input...
Is Geordi all right?
They've already hit him with   multiple phaser stuns.
He could need medical attention.
Security team stands ready to take   the initiative, sir.
Data?
Our options have not changed.   We can either respond to the   Pakled demand or not. We can   either use force or not.
I've already answered their   demand. Allowing access to the   Enterprise computers by alien   forces would be a complete breech   of Starfleet security.
Then force it must be.
Ready?
Get on with it, Doctor. I've got   work to do.
Activate Sterile Field. Neural   calipers.

This will be a secondary cardiac   procedure with mid-line entry and   excision of the early model unit.   I anticipate no complications as   the patient has had positive   primary results and exhibits   extraordinary physical condition.       We'll all be home in time for   dinner.    (holds his hand out,     palm up)   Tissue mitigator.
There is very little information   available on Pakled culture, but   the eclectic range of their   equipment would suggest that   everything they have has been   stolen from others.
scene: 46   INT. THE ENTERPRISE OBSERVATION LOUNGE - RIKER

quote: And now they have become militant.
scene: 46   INT. THE ENTERPRISE OBSERVATION LOUNGE - RIKER

quote: So it would seem.
scene: 46   INT. THE ENTERPRISE OBSERVATION LOUNGE - RIKER

quote: Rationale?
scene: 46   INT. THE ENTERPRISE OBSERVATION LOUNGE - RIKER

quote: They are unwilling to wait for   the timely evolution of their   species' intellectual capacity.   They seek instant knowledge,   instant power and gratification.
scene: 46   INT. THE ENTERPRISE OBSERVATION LOUNGE - RIKER

quote: You make them sound like petulant   children.
scene: 46   INT. THE ENTERPRISE OBSERVATION LOUNGE - RIKER

quote: Yes. Infantile humans are known   for responses of a similar nature.
scene: 46   INT. THE ENTERPRISE OBSERVATION LOUNGE - RIKER

quote: Then suppose we treat them like   children.
scene: 46   INT. THE ENTERPRISE OBSERVATION LOUNGE - RIKER

quote: Sir?
scene: 46   INT. THE ENTERPRISE OBSERVATION LOUNGE - RIKER

quote: It's time we set some limits.
scene: 46   INT. THE ENTERPRISE OBSERVATION LOUNGE - RIKER

quote: To what effect, sir? We are faced   with an impossible conundrum.
scene: 46   INT. THE ENTERPRISE OBSERVATION LOUNGE - RIKER

quote: Not if we let Geordi give them   something they want... and then   create the right moment for him   to take it away.
scene: 46   INT. THE ENTERPRISE OBSERVATION LOUNGE - RIKER

quote: Would you be suggesting a ruse   of some sort?
scene: 46   INT. THE ENTERPRISE OBSERVATION LOUNGE - RIKER

quote: I would.
scene: 46   INT. THE ENTERPRISE OBSERVATION LOUNGE - RIKER

quote: And what if it fails? What'll   happen to Geordi then?
scene: 46   INT. THE ENTERPRISE OBSERVATION LOUNGE - RIKER

quote: We don't have any choice. We have   to try.
scene: 46   INT. THE ENTERPRISE OBSERVATION LOUNGE - RIKER

quote: There has been some capillary   reaction here... let's proceed   carefully... we'll need sharper   focus on the thoracic   polychromatics and verification   of myocardial enzyme balance.
Let me talk to them. I'll get   you their computer banks.
scene: 48   INT. THE PAKLED MONDOR BRIDGE - GEORDI

quote: We want to be smart.
scene: 48   INT. THE PAKLED MONDOR BRIDGE - GEORDI

quote: So open the hailing frequency.   They'll listen to me.
scene: 48   INT. THE PAKLED MONDOR BRIDGE - GEORDI

quote: We are smart.
scene: 48   INT. THE PAKLED MONDOR BRIDGE - GEORDI

quote: We need their computer things.
scene: 48   INT. THE PAKLED MONDOR BRIDGE - GEORDI

quote: Yes.       Yes.
scene: 48   INT. THE PAKLED MONDOR BRIDGE - GEORDI

quote: Commander Riker?
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: Yes, Lieutenant. We're here.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: The Pakleds seem pretty sincere.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: We want what we want.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: Our computer banks are   non-negotiable.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: Excuse me, Commander, but let's   consider that for a minute. The   Enterprise's protected memory   storage is so extensive that it   would take well over twenty-four   hours just to access.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: In that time, maybe we could all   reach a more acceptable resolution   to our little misunderstanding   here.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: We want to be smart.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: Belive me, they're nothing if not   persistent.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: We want to be nothing if not   persistent.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: Nobody ever said they were great   conversationalists.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: Where did they get their shields?
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: Yes. We like shields.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: From what I've seen, half the   systems on this ship have been   stolen from Romulans, Jarada,   Klingons, just about anybody they   ever came in contact with.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: We like to be smart.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: Confirmed, Lieutenant La Forge.   They steal technology.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: But they lack the ability to use   it properly.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: You're an excellent chief   engineer, Lieutenant.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: Thank you, sir.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: And of course, your knowledge   of phaser and photon weaponry is   unmatched.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: We like phasers.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: That's kind of you to say, sir,   but Lieutenant Worf --
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: Our missions are always inherently   dangerous. Any of us could be   called upon to make the ultimate   sacrifice at any time.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: Uh... yes, sir, but --
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: Speaking of time, Lieutenant,   this may be your time. I shall   personally miss you.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: You will always be in my memory.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: Data... wait a minute. Can't   we.. ?
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: I shall miss you at weapons   systems analysis.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: Weapons system analysis?    (then, tentative, trying     it out)   I guess you'll just have to carry   out the photon torpedo countdowns   without me.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: Exactly. Fond farewell.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: He knows about weapons.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: He is smart.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: You can make us strong.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: It's not something I like to talk   about --
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: Lieutenant La Forge.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: Worf... my old friend.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: Any classified weapons knowledge   you share with your captors will   be considered treason.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: I may have no choice.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: You will die without honor.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: I know. Just my luck.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: You will never attain the   twenty-four levels of awareness.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: Twenty-four? That's quite a   challenge.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: Indeed. Twenty-four is the   gateway to heroic salvation.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: Do you think he understands?
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: He'd better.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: He is afraid.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: We all are, Counselor.
scene: 49   INT. THE ENTERPRISE BRIDGE - THE VIEWSCREEN (OPTICAL)

quote: You are smart.
Not smart enough. I'm still here.
Make us strong.
I thought you wanted me to help   you... "go". Why don't we work   on that guidance system, okay?
Make us strong. Or die.
The metabilation occlusions aren't   holding.
Damnit! I can't stop the   heterocyclic declination! Fuse!
Again!
We need a Biomolecular   Physiologist in here! This man   is dying!
You've gotta be kidding.
scene: 53   INT. THE MONDOR ARMAMENT BAY - GEORDI

quote: Make us strong.
scene: 53   INT. THE MONDOR ARMAMENT BAY - GEORDI

quote: There isn't enough juice in these   to blow off a passing asteroid.
scene: 53   INT. THE MONDOR ARMAMENT BAY - GEORDI

quote: Do it. Make us strong.
scene: 53   INT. THE MONDOR ARMAMENT BAY - GEORDI

quote: I suppose we could increase the   anti-matter charges.
scene: 53   INT. THE MONDOR ARMAMENT BAY - GEORDI

quote: Yes. We like power.
scene: 53   INT. THE MONDOR ARMAMENT BAY - GEORDI

quote: Do not try to trick us. We can   tell.
scene: 53   INT. THE MONDOR ARMAMENT BAY - GEORDI

quote: Metabilation?
Negative.
Heterocyclics?
Failing. And capillary integrity   too unpredictable to attempt a   resect.
You're unwilling to make the   attempt??
I'm not qualified.
I know someone who is.
Are you sure he can do it? He's   an engineer, not a weapons   specialist.
True. But if anyone can   improvise, it's Geordi.
What makes you think the Pakleds   even have that kind of gear on   board?
Ongoing scanning indicates   progressive weapons potential.       The timing will be crucial. He   must correctly interpret our   intentions.
Geordi's up to speed. I trust   his instincts.
The Pakleds did hear our little   fiction about Geordi's "weapons   knowledge."
Exactly. And since they obviously   equate intelligence with strength,   they won't pass up this chance   to use that knowledge.       Can you do it?
Count on it.
Bridge to Commander Riker!
Go ahead, bridge --
I am receiving an emergency   summons from Starbase   five one five... Captain Picard   is close to death!
Be ready!
We are strong.
You're now armed to the teeth.
Teeth are for chewing.
You have photon torpedoes. You   are strong.
We are strong. We have power.
Positive indication of armed   photon torpedoes, Commander.
scene: 58   INT. THE ENTERPRISE MAIN BRIDGE - RIKER

quote: Geordi did it.
scene: 58   INT. THE ENTERPRISE MAIN BRIDGE - RIKER

quote: Starbase requests we proceed to   base at warp nine --
scene: 58   INT. THE ENTERPRISE MAIN BRIDGE - RIKER

quote: We've got to go!
scene: 58   INT. THE ENTERPRISE MAIN BRIDGE - RIKER

quote: Yes. Captain Picard needs our   help.
scene: 58   INT. THE ENTERPRISE MAIN BRIDGE - RIKER

quote: We can't leave Geordi behind --       I want the Pakleds on that screen   and I want them now!
scene: 58   INT. THE ENTERPRISE MAIN BRIDGE - RIKER

quote: Forced spectrum communications   are spotty at best, sir.
scene: 58   INT. THE ENTERPRISE MAIN BRIDGE - RIKER

quote: Do it.
scene: 58   INT. THE ENTERPRISE MAIN BRIDGE - RIKER

quote: This is the Enterprise. Return   our personnel or face immediate   reprisal.
scene: 58   INT. THE ENTERPRISE MAIN BRIDGE - RIKER

quote: We are strong now. We have better   weapons.
scene: 58   INT. THE ENTERPRISE MAIN BRIDGE - RIKER

quote: Are you prepared to use them?
scene: 58   INT. THE ENTERPRISE MAIN BRIDGE - RIKER

quote: We are a force now. We will have   respect. Power.
scene: 58   INT. THE ENTERPRISE MAIN BRIDGE - RIKER

quote: They feel confident.
scene: 58   INT. THE ENTERPRISE MAIN BRIDGE - RIKER

quote: We don't have time for this. You   want power? This is power...       Bridge to Ensign Gomez...
scene: 58   INT. THE ENTERPRISE MAIN BRIDGE - RIKER

quote: Ready, Commander Riker --
Initiate sequencing.
Begin firing sequence countdown   from twenty-four.
They mean business. Let me just   check something.
Twenty-one... twenty...   nineteen... eighteen...
Seventeen... sixteen...   fifteen... fourteen...
Firing sequence proceeding, sir.
Hold fast.
Eleven... ten... nine...
We will attack.       We are strong.
We should attack now.
Just another second here...
Hurry.
six... five... four... three...
scene: 60D  INT. THE ENTERPRISE - MAIN BRIDGE - RIKER

quote: ...two... one...
Fire!
Now!
Oh no! Too late!
We have fired! They will be   destroyed.
But they used the crimson   force-field --
It did not shoot.
Their crimson force-field disarmed   us.
(re the Enterprise;     awed)   They are smart.
We are not strong.
Drop your shields and let us   transport Lieutenant La Forge   immediately.
Shields are down.
Transporter Room. One to beam   to the bridge.
Set heading for Starbase   five one five. Warp nine.
We leave you in peace.
We want to be strong.
Weapons alone do not create   strength. You must learn   restraint.
Yes. We will learn restraint.   Then we will be strong.
Off.
What was that red blast?
Hydrogen exhaust through the   Bussard collectors. Harmless,   but a nice light show.
Very impressive.
Did you disable their photons?
Just in time. That's why you're   all standing here...
What in the hell are you doing   here?
scene: 65   INT. STARBASE FIVE-ONE-FIVE SURGICAL SUITE - PICARD

quote: Saving your life.
scene: 65   INT. STARBASE FIVE-ONE-FIVE SURGICAL SUITE - PICARD

quote: Oh come on. This is a routine   procedure. Quite commonplace.
scene: 65   INT. STARBASE FIVE-ONE-FIVE SURGICAL SUITE - PICARD

quote: True. But you are not a   commonplace man. You'll be out   of recovery in four hours.
scene: 65   INT. STARBASE FIVE-ONE-FIVE SURGICAL SUITE - PICARD

quote: I didn't want you involved in   this.
scene: 65   INT. STARBASE FIVE-ONE-FIVE SURGICAL SUITE - PICARD

quote: You're welcome.
scene: 65   INT. STARBASE FIVE-ONE-FIVE SURGICAL SUITE - PICARD

quote: If you're here... the entire crew   must know...
scene: 65   INT. STARBASE FIVE-ONE-FIVE SURGICAL SUITE - PICARD

quote: You're still the captain.   Invincible.
scene: 65   INT. STARBASE FIVE-ONE-FIVE SURGICAL SUITE - PICARD

quote: Thank you.
scene: 65   INT. STARBASE FIVE-ONE-FIVE SURGICAL SUITE - PICARD

quote: I beg your pardon.
Looks like things are back to   normal...

I'm pleased to report that Ensign   Crusher's Starfleet exam results   will enable him to continue with   his studies on board the   Enterprise. Furthermore, any   rumors of my brush with death   are greatly exaggerated. Is that   clear?
Yes, sir.
Good. Set the course for Epsilon   Sector.       Warp five, Ensign.
Engage.
